alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Fluvanna; Goochland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 9:32AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties, Cumberland, Fluvanna and Goochland. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 929 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen with the first round of rain earlier this morning. - A second round of rain will bring additional amounts up to 2 inches over the same area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fork Union, Cartersville, Columbia, Duncan, Lakeside Village, Dixie, Carysbrook, Bremo Bluff, Cohasset, Stage Junction, Trenton Mills, Central Plains, Shores, Elk Hill, Pemberton, Hardware and Tamworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
